Saw this in the theater at 48 fps. Blew me away. The first hour or so is really all it took me to get used to it (it will seem like people are moving too fast at first) but then it was fantastic. People, this is one movie (and Peter Jackson is one man) worth giving your money to. Even if you don't have a local theater showing it with the new frame rate technology, see it at least in IMAX or IMAX 3D. By paying for this one you're sending a message to other directors and producers that 48 fps is worth investing in.
